summary: This document outlines a petition for an advisory opinion regarding an irrevocable trust created by the Senior, detailing the terms of the trust agreement, including the Settlor's rights and the Substitution Power. It discusses the conditions under which the Settlor can reacquire trust property and the implications for tax purposes.

persons.name: Senior
persons.context: The Senior is the individual who created the irrevocable trust and has specific rights under the trust agreement.

persons.name: Trustees
persons.context: The Trustees are responsible for managing the trust property and ensuring compliance with the trust agreement.

keyFacts: The document discusses an irrevocable trust created by the Senior.
The Settlor has the right to reacquire trust property through a Substitution Power.
The Settlor can exercise this power without the consent of the Trustees.
The document mentions the payment of New York State sales tax related to the Substituted Property.
Trustees may allow beneficiaries to use the Substituted Property without charge.
